dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 1
dialogue_turns.text: Oh my god. What, uh, what's so funny?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh my god. What, uh, what's so funny?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 2
dialogue_turns.text: Ridder. Seriously. Ridder. Yeah, the city in East Kazakhstan. They, uh, they changed their work schedule.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Ridder. Seriously. Ridder. Yeah, the city in East Kazakhstan. They, uh, they changed their work schedule.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The work schedule for government institutions, enterprises, and social services has changed in Ridder. Starting March 14, the workday for residents of Ridder in the East Kazakhstan region begins one hour earlier...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 1
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, I got that. Eight to five-thirty. With, like, an hour and a half for lunch. Riveting.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, I got that. Eight to five-thirty. With, like, an hour and a half for lunch. Riveting.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: ...from 8:00 AM to 5:30 PM, with a lunch break from 12:00 PM to 1:30 PM.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 2
dialogue_turns.text: No, but, I mean, it's actually kind of a big deal for them. They're trying to, you know, optimize things.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: No, but, I mean, it's actually kind of a big deal for them. They're trying to, you know, optimize things.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The city's akimat explained that this change aims to optimize work processes and improve efficiency, taking into account the region's climatic conditions.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 1
dialogue_turns.text: Optimize? So, like, force everyone to wake up earlier? That's, um, peak optimization.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Optimize? So, like, force everyone to wake up earlier? That's, um, peak optimization.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 2
dialogue_turns.text: Well, the deputy akim, Bolat Akuzhanov, he said it's about using the morning hours more effectively. And, like, the daylight.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, the deputy akim, Bolat Akuzhanov, he said it's about using the morning hours more effectively. And, like, the daylight.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: "Now, residents have more energy since morning hours are used effectively, and daylight allows for more tasks to be completed without additional strain," said Ridder's Deputy Akim Bolat Akuzhanov.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 1
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, the magic of daylight. Because everyone just, uh, couldn't figure out how to use it before eight AM.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, the magic of daylight. Because everyone just, uh, couldn't figure out how to use it before eight A M.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 2
dialogue_turns.text: But listen, Nazgul Untabaeva, a resident, she's really happy. She says it's super convenient for women with kids.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But listen, Nazgul Untabaeva, a resident, she's really happy. She says it's super convenient for women with kids.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: "This is truly a convenient schedule, especially for women with children. ..." said Ridder resident Nazgul Untabaeva.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 1
dialogue_turns.text: Convenient. Forcing people to start work earlier is convenient. Mmm-hmm.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Convenient. Forcing people to start work earlier is convenient. Mmm-hmm.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 2
dialogue_turns.text: No, but seriously! She was saying how they can pick up their kids without rushing. And get chores done, you know, because they were already up early anyway.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: No, but seriously! She was saying how they can pick up their kids without rushing. And get chores done, you know, because they were already up early anyway.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: "Now we can pick up our kids from kindergarten or school without rushing, without worrying about asking for time off or finding someone to help. Moreover, this schedule allows for more time to handle household chores. We were already waking up early, dropping off our children, and then wasting time before the workday started at 9 AM."

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 1
dialogue_turns.text: Right, so, like, instead of wasting time before work, they're now just working during that wasted time. Brilliant.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, so, like, instead of wasting time before work, they're now just working during that wasted time. Brilliant.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 2
dialogue_turns.text: But it's about, uh, better work-life balance. And they consulted the residents, who, like, supported it.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But it's about, uh, better work-life balance. And they consulted the residents, who, like, supported it.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: According to Ridder's Deputy Akim Bolat Akuzhanov, several meetings were held with residents before the decision to switch to the new work schedule was made, and the issue was thoroughly discussed. "The city's residents supported this initiative. I believe the new work schedule will improve time management and allow for a better balance between work and personal life," noted the Deputy Akim of Ridder.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 1
dialogue_turns.text: Sure they did. "Support our initiative or else, comrade."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Sure they did. Support our initiative or else, comrade.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 2
dialogue_turns.text: No! Other districts already did it too, like Altai and Ulan. It's a whole, um, regional movement.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: No! Other districts already did it too, like Altai and Ulan. It's a whole, um, regional movement.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: On March 12, the Altai and Ulan districts joined.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 1
dialogue_turns.text: So, like, everyone's just getting up an hour earlier now. Amazing. What about Ust-Kamenogorsk? Still holding out?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, like, everyone's just getting up an hour earlier now. Amazing. What about Ust-Kamenogorsk? Still holding out?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: As of now, the issue of transitioning to the new work schedule in Ust-Kamenogorsk remains unresolved.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 2
dialogue_turns.text: Uh, yeah, that's still unresolved. But the point is, it seems to, like, actually help people.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Uh, yeah, that's still unresolved. But the point is, it seems to, like, actually help people.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: As of now, the issue of transitioning to the new work schedule in Ust-Kamenogorsk remains unresolved.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 1
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, help them, uh, get to work in the dark for half the year. Wonderful.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, help them, uh, get to work in the dark for half the year. Wonderful.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 2
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, come on, it's about, uh, the specific climatic conditions, too. It's practical.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, come on, it's about, uh, the specific climatic conditions, too. It's practical.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The city's akimat explained that this change aims to optimize work processes and improve efficiency, taking into account the region's climatic conditions.
